name: Sugar Confections
description: Expensive sweets made with refined sugar, such as candied fruits, marzipan, and other elaborate desserts. Enjoyed primarily by the nobility and wealthy merchants.

historicalNotes.historicalSignificance: The availability of sugar through Venetian trade routes led to the development of a sophisticated confectionery art. These items were often given as diplomatic gifts.
historicalNotes.culturalContext: Sugar confections were a display of wealth and artistry, prominent at banquets and special occasions.
